chargeHist.descr: Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker or Prosecutor

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

1:49 PM Defendant Marcus D Hollins in court, in custody.  Attorney Sophia Dolan in court for Marcus D Hollins.  Attorney Dirk Christian Jensen in court for State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter:  Nancy Szeklinski. 
Deft. to plea in 22CF275 to Cts. 1, 2, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8.  State recommends 2 yrs. IC, 3 yrs. ES, defense fta.  Ct. 3 to be dri.  Case 21CF869 to be dismissed.

PLEA: Cts. 1, 2, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8: G
BTC; Cts. 1, 2, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8: GUILTY.  Ct. 3: Dismissed. Case 21CF869: Dismissed.
Parties are willing to waive PSI and are requesting to set out sentencing hearing for defense to submit a sentencing memorandum.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defense has filed a motion to compel in 22CF275.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
